channel.title: Changing an item's name
channel.description: I know I've been asking alot of questions lately, and I am truly sorry. I've been trying to change the name of a "team wilderness cape" I've already changed it on the item.cfg, which basically just changed it when trading or selling to a store. I know that you have to go to the class8.java to change it. But my client didnt have any .java's so i had to decompile the class8.class... Once i did I did not find the item in the file. So at this point, I do not know how to change the items name, so some help will be appreciated.

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @king_gauge king gauge
item.description:
@king_gauge wrote:

Or you can just get a 317 item dump and add it through that way in class8… it is also safer to do it that way, since you can always just take it back out, as with editting the cache you take the chance of destroying the whole thing and starting over again.

My suggestion, get 317 item dump and find the ints to the items you want in there and just rename it and change the descrition to what you want and add it to the Class8.java
Then renaming it in the Item.cfg as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @short_asian_kid short_asian_kid
item.description:
@short_asian_kid wrote:

you will have to go into your client to change the name, re add the model and inits, and write the name and examin information that you would like.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @WhyPlayLegit WhyPlayLegit
item.description:
@WhyPlayLegit wrote:

I was just wondering if this was possible, because I really haven’t found a way to change this item’s name.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

WhyPlayLegit:

Yes, I just said that all it changed was the “value check” when trading an NPC -.-

oh okay sorry

Read full topic

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

[quote author=WhyPlayLegit link=topic=441067.msg3240005#msg3240005 date=1276834472]

[quote=“gangsta tony, post:2, topic:344698”]1. Go to your Config folder
2. Find item.cfg
3. Search the item ID and you can change the name of it and also you can also change the description
4. Go to class8.java
5. Search the item
6. Change the name[/quote]

Thanks for helping, but i just said the item wasn’t in the class8

Did you check in item.cfg?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @WhyPlayLegit WhyPlayLegit
item.description:
@WhyPlayLegit wrote:

[quote=“gangsta tony, post:2, topic:344698”]1. Go to your Config folder
2. Find item.cfg
3. Search the item ID and you can change the name of it and also you can also change the description
4. Go to class8.java
5. Search the item
6. Change the name[/quote]

Thanks for helping, but i just said the item wasn’t in the class8

(Don't get pissed over this, this is a common mistake.) you compiled after you changed in item.cfg, correct?

Yes, I did, and the only time the name changed was when you check its value while trading an NPC, but not the name itself

Read full topic

item.title: Changing an item's name
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

  1. Go to your Config folder
  2. Find item.cfg
  3. Search the item ID and you can change the name of it and also you can also change the description
  4. Go to class8.java
  5. Search the item
  6. Change the name

Read full topic

@WhyPlayLegit wrote:

I know I’ve been asking alot of questions lately, and I am truly sorry.
I’ve been trying to change the name of a “team wilderness cape”
I’ve already changed it on the item.cfg, which basically just changed it when trading or selling to a store.
I know that you have to go to the class8.java to change it. But my client didnt have any .java’s so i had to decompile the class8.class…
Once i did I did not find the item in the file. So at this point, I do not know how to change the items name, so some help will be appreciated.
